intro: Suffrenia capensis, commonly known as the Cape bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, clustered flowers that attract pollinators. Suffrenia capensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
